scenario_name: 2025 GlobalTech FY25 Sales & Product Innovation Kickoff
company_context: GlobalTech Solutions is a mid‑size (≈1,200 employees) technology firm specializing in cloud‑based SaaS platforms for the financial services sector. The FY25 Kickoff is hosted by the GlobalTech Go‑to‑Market (GTM) organization, which includes 150 members across Product Management, Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Operations. The GTM team reports to the Chief Commercial Officer and is structured into three product lines (Core Banking, Risk Analytics, and Payments) plus a cross‑functional Enablement squad.
meeting_event_details: June 10‑12, 2025 (3 days). Day 1: 08:00‑18:00, Day 2: 08:30‑19:00, Day 3: 09:00‑16:00. Venue: Hyatt Regency Denver, 650 17th Street, Denver, CO – Main Ballroom for plenary sessions, three breakout rooms (North, South, West), and the rooftop terrace for the welcome reception. All times are Mountain Daylight Time (MDT).
stakeholders: Laura Martinez – Chief Executive Officer (overall sponsor, opening keynote)
Raj Patel – Chief Financial Officer (budget sign‑off, FY25 financial outlook)
Megan O'Connor – Chief Commercial Officer (event owner, success metrics)
Diego Alvarez – VP, Product Management (product line strategy presentations)
Sofia Liu – VP, Global Sales (sales targets and enablement plan)
Ethan Brooks – VP, Marketing (brand and demand‑gen roadmap)
Nina Gupta – Director, Customer Success (customer insights session)
Tommy Reed – Senior Program Manager, Events (logistics lead)
Karen Whitfield – HR Business Partner (team‑building activities)
Alexis Chen – External Keynote Speaker, Gartner Analyst (industry trends)
Javier Morales – AV & Production Lead (live‑streaming, recording)
Olivia Bennett – Procurement Lead (catering, swag, contracts)
deliverables: Master Kickoff Deck (incl. agenda, speaker bios, branding)
FY25 GTM Strategic Roadmap (PDF & interactive PowerPoint)
Product Launch Playbook for the new Payments API (docx)
Cross‑functional OKR matrix (Excel) with owners and timelines
Recorded video of all plenary sessions uploaded to the internal LMS
Post‑event Survey Report (response rate, NPS, qualitative feedback)
Event Logistics Pack (venue contracts, floor plan, catering menus, swag inventory)
Budget Reconciliation Report (actual vs. planned spend)
success_criteria: ≥ 95 % of invited GTM team members attend in‑person or via live stream
Overall event satisfaction score ≥ 4.5/5 on post‑event survey
Net Promoter Score (NPS) for the kickoff ≥ 70
At least 3 new cross‑functional initiatives identified and documented in the OKR matrix
All key deliverables (roadmap, playbook, OKRs) completed and shared within 5 business days after the event
Event executed within the approved budget of $120,000 (± 5 %)
Zero critical AV or catering incidents reported during the three days
constraints: Planning horizon T‑60 (finalized plan must be locked by April 11, 2025)
Total budget capped at $120,000, inclusive of venue, catering, AV, travel subsidies, and swag
Venue capacity limited to 200 on‑site attendees; remote participation limited to 50 concurrent streams
All external vendors must be vetted through GlobalTech’s preferred supplier list
COVID‑19 contingency: must have a backup virtual‑only format ready within 48 hours of any health‑related restriction
Swag items must be ESG‑compliant (recyclable packaging, no single‑use plastics)
workback_prompt: Create a detailed work‑back plan for the 2025 GlobalTech FY25 Sales & Product Innovation Kickoff (June 10‑12, 2025, Hyatt Regency Denver). Include all major work‑streams (strategy alignment, speaker coordination, venue & AV, catering, swag procurement, travel logistics, communications, on‑site execution, post‑event deliverables), key milestones, dependencies, owners, and estimated effort. Align the plan with the T‑60 planning horizon, $120k budget, and the success criteria listed. Provide a Gantt‑style timeline (by week) and a risk mitigation matrix for the identified constraints.
